content: [aleo] "All these questions; I'm being rude. Please, join us. Let us feast in your honor."
[aleo] "A varl leader saving a human village from...those things! Legends are made of much less."
[aleo] "Boersgard is the only other place I've seen in my life; this small village is all my family knows. Are things really as tragic as you're making them sound?"
[aleo] "But the dredge are gone. We defeated them."
[aleo] "But what about the deep shaking in the ground? Only yesterday, we felt a rumble like none before."
[aleo] "But what about the deep shaking in the ground? Only yesterday, we felt a rumble like none before."

content.option: "You think we have all the answers?"

content: [aleo] "By...by your clan? You're Sundr-Slayers?"
[aleo] "Forgive me - maybe it's this never-setting sun, or dredge, or the deaths of so many of my clansmen. I'm not myself."
/=Aleo heads off to the village to organize supplies.=/
/=He stops speaking as the village chieftain approaches.=/
[aleo] "I'm Aleo, the skald. Were you trying to drive the dredge all the way back north by yourself?"
[aleo] "I'm Aleo, the skald. Were you trying to drive the dredge all the way back north by yourself?"
[aleo] "I'm exchanging information with you. It's a normal thing to do here."
[aleo] "Killing a Sundr is a big enough tale on its own, for now."
/=Aleo looks into your eyes for a moment before recoiling.=/
/=Aleo looks shocked and confused.=/
/=Aleo looks stunned by your words.=/
[aleo] "No, I'm thankful. It's just..."
[aleo] "Nonsense! You've just arrived and defended us. Don't insult us by leaving before we thank you properly."
[aleo] "Not to sound ungrateful, but this place...it's all we have. It's our home."
[aleo] "Not to sound ungrateful, but this place...it's all we have. It's our home."

content.option: "Don't be stupid. More dredge are coming."

content: [aleo] "Of course. Mind if I ask of news from Boersgard? We heard rumor the Sundr Bellower was laying waste to the town."
[aleo] "Packing and tending to our dead will take some time, but I'll have everyone on the ships soon."
[aleo] "Rook is right. I hoped their defeat here today would keep the dredge away, but when voiced..."
[aleo] "So, Iver, we heard rumors about the Sundr, Bellower, sacking Boersgard."
[aleo] "Something terrible must've happened to have such hatred for them."
[aleo] "So soon? But the villagers will want to throw a feast to honor you before you go."
[aleo] "That reminds me: we heard rumor the Sundr, Bellower, was laying waste to Boersgard."
[aleo] "The Serpent in the Sun, Radormyr? I'm no holy man, but joking about dead gods feels wrong."
/=He has been by your side through everything including the death of your daughter. Now you feel the weight of his full attention.=/
[$hero aleo] "Then let's get ready to leave."
[$hero] "Alette was my reason for living after Aldis died."
[$hero] "And she's still gone! I shouldn't have let her fire that arrow."
[$hero] "But they weren't supposed to protect her! That was my job! And I let her die."
[$hero] "Get used to things not being normal anymore."
[$hero] "I don't care about a faen plan. They killed her."
[$hero] "I know this village lost fighters today, so they have less of a chance defending themselves tomorrow."
/=Iver moves you past the crowd of worried villagers ensuring you can stand on your own.=/
[$hero] "What changed your mind?"
[$hero] "You've got a lot to learn about dredge."
/=He walks towards the village, leaving you alone with your thoughts.=/
/=Aleo looks back and forth between you and Iver before nodding.=/
/=The skald looks around at the small huts of his village.=/
[iver aleo] "He means all of us, your people too."
[iver aleo] "I meant all of us should be going. Your people too."
[iver aleo] "Probably worse."
[iver] "A topic for another time, skald. Maybe."
[iver $hero] "And it was Rook here who ordered us to stop."
[iver $hero] "Bellower killed her. And we killed him."
[iver $hero] "Enough. We need to leave."
[iver $hero] "I don't know what you were--"
[iver $hero] "I felt the same way back on the bridge in Einartoft."
[iver $hero] "I remember. But make this caravan your reason now; there's still plenty for you to do."
[iver $hero] "Keep holding it all in and you'll lose it when these people need you most."
[iver $hero] "Listen, I don't know what's in your head right now, but you dying won't bring your daughter back."
[iver $hero] "Maybe that's why you charged into those dredge alone: you think you deserve to die."
[iver $hero] "More than the world will break if I'm left to do all the talking."
[iver $hero] "Not much of a plan."
[iver $hero] "Not sure it has changed, but these people? They need a leader - that better be enough to change yours."
[iver $hero] "No varl leader, just Iver. Those /=things =/were dredge, like the stories you probably heard as a kid."
[iver $hero] "People thinking we're heroes now? The world is breaking in more ways than one."
[iver $hero] "Since Rook's not talking, I'm telling you to pack and get on the ships. Now."
[iver $hero] "These people need you now more than they know. Their lives depend on your decisions."
[iver $hero] "The world breaking. Dredge mothers fighting alongside warriors. A giant Serpent. Not sure what to make of it all."
[iver $hero] "Wanting to defend what's yours isn't stupid. You know that."
[iver $hero] "We all do."
[iver $hero] "What you pulled out there - fighting the dredge alone - was that tied to Alette at all?"
[iver $hero] "What you pulled out there - fighting the dredge alone - was that tied to Alette at all?"

content.option: "They'll pay for taking her from me."
"I'm trying my best to hold it all together."
"The villagers could probably use your strength."

content: [iver $hero] "You couldn't have stopped that anymore than you could stop the wind blowing."
[iver] "I don't know about losing a child, but I understand losing a friend. And that she was."
/=Iver looks at you expectantly, then sighs.=/
[iver] "More than a rumor, but he's been dealt with."
[iver] "No time for that. We should be going."
/=Iver places his large hand on your shoulder.=/
[iver $hero] "About as opposite of Radormyr as it gets - this one's determined to swallow us all."
[iver $hero] "No. We didn't risk ourselves so the dredge could kill you tomorrow."
[iver] "You can't afford to act like that. She was important to everyone here."
/=Only the lapping waves on the bank disturb the silence.=/
/=Iver, one of the giants known as varl, has fought dredge in the northern winters, personally killed the Sundr Raze, and lost an arm to the Sundr Bellower. =/
{skip} mark1=$hero mark2=aleo mark3=iver
/=The man's eyes appraise you and he quickly nods.=/
/=The skald looks back and forth between you and Iver, unsure on how to proceed.=/
/=The skald looks skeptical.=/
/=The term makes Iver wince and ends Aleo's excitement. =/
/=You clench your jaw and look away.=/
